com.communote.common.menu

Class SimpleMenuBuilder<C extends MenuEntry,S extends MenuEntry>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.communote.common.menu.SimpleMenuBuilder<C,S>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - type of the categories
    S - type of the sub-items

    public class SimpleMenuBuilder<C extends MenuEntry,S extends MenuEntry>
extends Object
    Builder to create a SimpleMenu with entries that are sorted according to a declarative defined position. This builder also supports a filtering mechanism to dynamically decide whether a certain category or category entry should be included in the menu.
    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/

    • Method Detail

      • addCategory

        public boolean addCategory(C item,
                           PositionDescriptor positionDescriptor)
        Add a new category to the first level of the menu. If there is already a category with that ID the new one is ignored.

        If called several times with position type TOP the categories which were added later will be positioned before those added earlier. If called several times with position type BOTTOM or AFTER (and the same menu entry ID to position after), the categories which were added later will be positioned after those added earlier. Entries with position type TOP are always before the BOTTOM positioned categories. Categories with position type AFTER will not appear in the resulting menu if the referenced category does not exist. However, if that referenced category is added later on, the categories to position after that category will than be contained in the menu.

        Parameters:
        item - the item to add
        positionDescriptor - descriptor defining where the item should be added. If null the category will be added to the bottom.
        Returns:
        whether the category was added or there was already a category with the same ID

      • addCategoryEntryFilter

        public void addCategoryEntryFilter(MenuEntryFilter<S> filter)
        Add a filter that will be called when the menu is built to decide whether a menu entry should be added to its category.
        Parameters:
        filter - the filter to add

      • addCategoryFilter

        public void addCategoryFilter(MenuEntryFilter<C> filter)
        Add a filter that will be called when the menu is built to decide whether a category should be included in the menu.
        Parameters:
        filter - the filter to add

      • addToCategory

        public boolean addToCategory(String categoryId,
                             S item,
                             PositionDescriptor positionDescriptor)
        Add a menu item to a category. If the category does not exist the item won't be contained in the menu. But if the category is added later on this item will be added automatically to the category.

        If called several times with position type TOP the entries which were added later will be positioned before those added earlier. If called several times with position type BOTTOM or AFTER (and the same menu entry ID to position after), the entries which were added later will be positioned after those added earlier. Entries with position type TOP are always before the BOTTOM positioned entries. Entries with position type AFTER will not appear in the resulting menu if the referenced menu entry does not exist. However, if that referenced entry is added later on, the entries to position after that entry will than be contained in the category.

        Parameters:
        categoryId - the ID of the category
        item - the item to add
        positionDescriptor - descriptor defining where the item should be added. If null the item will be added to the bottom
        Returns:
        whether the entry was added or there was already an entry with the same ID

      • buildMenu

        public SimpleMenu<C,S> buildMenu()
        Create the final menu. Should always be called after adding/removing categories or menu items because the children of a category are not directly updated.
        Returns:
        the created menu

      • filterCategory

        protected boolean filterCategory(C category)
        Apply the registered category filters to the category and return whether it should be added to the menu
        Parameters:
        category - the category to test
        Returns:
        true if the category should be included false otherwise

      • filterEntry

        protected boolean filterEntry(S entry)
        Apply the registered filters to the entry and return whether it should be added to the category.
        Parameters:
        entry - the entry to test
        Returns:
        true if the entry should be included false otherwise

      • getCategory

        public C getCategory(String categoryId)
        Get a category
        Parameters:
        categoryId - the ID of the category
        Returns:
        the category or null if there is no category for the given ID

      • getCategoryEntry

        public S getCategoryEntry(String categoryId,
                          String entryId)
        Get a category entry. This will even return an entry if the category of the entry was removed.
        Parameters:
        categoryId - the ID of the category
        entryId - the ID of the entry in the category
        Returns:
        the entry or null if the entry was not added to a category with the given ID

      • isCachable

        protected boolean isCachable()
        Denotes whether the built menu can be cached and should only be recreated if the menu content changed.

        This implementation assumes that registered filters lead to a menu that is not cacheable.

        Returns:
        true if the menu can be cached, false otherwise

      • menuContentChanged

        protected void menuContentChanged()
        Is invoked if a category or category entry was added or removed.

        This implementation discards the cached menu.

      • removeCategory

        public boolean removeCategory(C item)
        Remove a previously added category. The items that were added to that category are not removed but will instead just not be in the resulting menu. If the category is added again the items will also be contained in the menu again.
        Parameters:
        item - the category to remove
        Returns:
        whether the category existed and was removed

      • removeCategory

        public boolean removeCategory(String categoryId)
        Same as removeCategory(C) but removes the category by its ID.
        Parameters:
        categoryId - the ID of the category to remove
        Returns:
        whether the category existed and was removed

      • removeCategoryEntryFilter

        public void removeCategoryEntryFilter(MenuEntryFilter<S> filter)
        Remove a previously added filter
        Parameters:
        filter - the filter to remove

      • removeCategoryFilter

        public void removeCategoryFilter(MenuEntryFilter<C> filter)
        Remove a previously added filter
        Parameters:
        filter - the filter to remove

      • removeFromCategory

        public S removeFromCategory(String categoryId,
                            S item)
        Remove a previously added item from a category.
        Parameters:
        categoryId - the ID of the category from which the entry should be removed
        item - the item to remove
        Returns:
        the removed entry if the entry existed in the category, otherwise null

      • removeFromCategory

        public S removeFromCategory(String categoryId,
                            String itemId)
        Same as removeFromCategory(String, S) but searches the item by its ID.
        Parameters:
        categoryId - the ID of the category from which the entry should be removed
        itemId - the ID of the item to remove
        Returns:
        the removed entry if the entry existed in the category, otherwise null
